headline: Fed releases minutes from meeting where it held rates steady and outlined inflation strategy
summary: The Federal Open Market Committee on Wednesday released minutes from its Sept. 15-16 meeting.

headline: Stocks rise after Trump backs relief for airlines—Larry Kudlow and others on what’s next
summary: Stocks were up on Wednesday after President Trump, who announced Tuesday that he was ending talks on coronavirus relief legislation, urged Congress to approve several targeted relief measures, including for airlines. Here's what four experts are saying.
Third Point Capital's Dan Loeb is calling on Disney to permanently suspend annual dividend, use funds for Disney+ content.
headline: Activist investor Dan Loeb calls on Disney to end its $3 billion annual dividend and use the funds for Disney+ content

summary: "We need to have a great air business. Why do we want to wreck it?" Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel told CNBC.
headline: Booking Holdings CEO makes a plea for aid for airline industry: 'Why do we want to wreck it?'
Pandemic accelerated an already booming market for personal chefs
summary: The personal chef business is booming as more consumers eat at home during the coronavirus pandemic, rather than restaurants.

headline: Self-made millionaire Elizabeth Elting: 'The usual success tips for women aren't working' today
summary: Elizabeth Elting is a millionaire entrepreneur and philanthropist who led her company through two major crises as co-CEO. Now, she's offering advice for how career women can thrive during today's pandemic.

headline: Options traders make big, bullish bets on crude oil
summary: Options traders are tossing money at the oil markets and positioning themselves for what could be a big move higher.

headline: Amazon's Twitch dominates game streaming market after Microsoft Mixer shutdown
summary: People watched 4.7 billion hours of video through Twitch in the third quarter. That's down 8% from the second quarter when the coronavirus lockdowns kept more people home, providing additional time to watch game streams online.

headline: Don't expect Hollywood blockbusters to return until more cinemas in New York and California reopen
summary: Many analysts fear that these blockbuster films won't return until there is a viable coroanvirus vaccine or California and New York reopen more theaters.
Even though Democrats and Republicans are in broad agreement that Big Tech has monopoly power, their differences on how to fix the problem make it doubtful sweeping tech regulation will come to pass.
headline: Democrats and Republicans disagree on how to curb Big Tech's power — here's where they differ

summary: Chris Hogan is a financial expert and radio show host who helps people make better decisions with their money. Here's how much he recommends that you save for retirement.
headline: Americans think they need $1.9 million to retire. Here's how much you really need

summary: Multiple people linked to President Trump have tested positive for coronavirus, including Trump himself, Melania Trump, Hope Hicks and Kayleigh McEnany.

Watch live: World Health Organization holds Q&A on the coronavirus outbreak
summary: "Many deaths have been averted and many more lives can be protected," Dr. Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, said Monday.

headline: Asset management companies face more consolidation after activist investor takes stakes in two big players, analysts say
summary: Consolidation may be inevitable for asset managers as Nelson Peltz's Trian Partners takes substantial stakes in Janus Henderson and Invesco, analysts say.

headline: Cramer: You're going to be on the 'wrong side of the trade' if you invest based on Trump’s tweets

summary: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer said on CNBC Wednesday: "I'll bet money that they will not be broken up," while discussing a House Judiciary antitrust subcommittee report that said Amazon, Alphabet, Apple and Facebook enjoy 'monopoly power.'
headline: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer: I’ll bet money Big Tech won’t be broken up

summary: As the impasse in Washington intensifies, Kashkari told CNBC that workers, businesses and governments need more cash from Congress.
headline: Fed's Kashkari warns delaying stimulus will have 'enormous consequences'
September 2020 was the hottest on record worldwide
summary: Arctic sea ice also plunged to its second-lowest levels on record, scientists confirmed, as climate change takes an alarming toll on the region.
